channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Author Elizabeth Gilbert talks about trying to understand that she isn't a bad person
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author Elizabeth Gilbert opens up about trying to understand that she wasn't a bad person.

item.title: Illinois Gov. Pritzker talks about ICE agents in Chicago
item.description: President Donald Trump has promised to crack down on crime in Chicago. NPR Morning Edition host Steve Inskeep spoke with Governor Pritzker in Chicago about the potential for racial profiling.

item.title: It's been 80 years since the United Nations was formed
item.description: As the United Nations turns 80, NPR examines its legacy, its current challenges, and what lies ahead for the world's multilateral body.

item.title: Student test scores drop
item.description: The Nation's Report Card was released for 12th grade math and reading, along with 8th grade science. Scores dipped across the board, following a decade long decline.

item.title: How the Rhone and other rivers were used in ancient times
item.description: They developed a computer model that estimates how easily Roman and Celtic travelers navigated rivers thousands of years ago.

item.title: A look at the summer and fall box office
item.description: This past summer's box office was sluggish, but over the weekend, Hollywood found help in the form of the devil. The Conjuring: Last Rites ended up having the top horror movie opening of all time.

item.title: What will happen to dance, with a major grant program changing?
item.description: Twenty dance projects from around the country won grants totaling $100,000 dollars each today. These grants are among the most coveted in the dance world, but this round of winners is the last of its kind due to a funding shortage.

item.title: What to know about the turmoil in Nepal
item.description: Nepal's army chief has threatened to "take control of the situation" as protesters attack politicians and burn down parliament and government buildings a day after security forces killed 19 people.

item.title: Supreme Court agrees to hear challenge to some of Trump's sweeping tariffs
item.description: The tariffs have become a flashpoint, with two lower courts declaring them illegal, and the president asking the Supreme Court for reversal as soon as possible.

item.title: A musical about Luigi Mangione sells out theaters — and raises eyebrows
item.description: The UnitedHealthcare CEO's alleged killer was in the same Brooklyn jail as Diddy and Sam Bankman-Fried. A satirical comedy about their jailhouse vibe is selling out theaters — and raising eyebrows.
